text: They were more then fair with price . I was in a bind and they  were amazing.

resp.text: We're glad we could help, thank you Luke. Take care!

name: john
text: I brought my wife's car in for a few things (power steering pump, alignment, and oil leak) right before we left for vacation. As we were on vacation the shop kept us updated on everything that was going on. (A part was having to be ordered from out of state) The original quote was $1,000 which I was OK with because they wanted to do a transmission flush as well. For the amount of work and parts I was happy with price. They called about half way through our week long trip to give us an update and the shop owner stated he would have it done before we got back or worst case senario, the day we got back. He also stated he thought it would be a bit cheaper, about $950, well that's great. No problem there! So the day we got home he called and said the car was finished and that he was able to do all the work for $860!!! He very well could have charged me the $1000 and I would have gladly payed. He instead did the honorable thing and charged me what it cost him! Also, very clean shop!!

resp.text: Thank you, John! We’re thrilled that you’re happy with our services.

name: Deona Elaine
text: I was on my way to New Orleans and blew a tire on the interstate on the way. Downtown car care was the closest place to me and I’m so glad I was able to get their help. As soon as I called, they sent a tow truck and the owner was able to work with me on the cost of the tire I needed. Because I had a security bolt on my wheel and didn’t have the key for it, they had to remove the bolt — and they handled it for free! Instead of replacing both tires in the back, they only replaced the one that blew after looking at the condition of the other wheel which was super helpful since I told them I was on a budget. Since I’m a female, I’ve always felt wary of mechanics, but since visiting this shop, they’ve restored my faith in the business! Thank you for your hard work, flexibility, and kindness!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review, Deona! We take great strides to make sure our clients are satisfied and appreciate when a client sees that we work hard on their behalf.

name: John Connolly
text: Fast service. Friendly staff. Really helped us out in a bind and got us back on the road again quickly. Breaking down in an unfamiliar area, states away from home, can be daunting. Everyone was exceptional.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave such a thoughtful review, John. It’s customers like you that make our job so enjoyable!

name: Cody Plaisance
text: My wife and I were traveling to Gulf Shores from Baton Rouge for a family vacation and at 3:00 both our rear breaks went out and we managed to get it to Downtown Car Care and they took it in, fixed it, and were back on the road in no time at all. This was all at an extremely reasonable price and would recommend these people to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for the review! We hope your vacation goes super awesome!

name: NamJung Homeschool
text:
I am YounJi from University of Alabama. My family and I had a trip to Mobile, and our car stopped working on a roadside. We looked up all the reviews and chose "Downtown Car Care" to help us.

The car broke down at 3pm on Friday. We thought there is no way to fix this car since it was late of the day. However, this place shocked me with the fastest service. They changed the broken alternator and replace to a new one in an hour. We really didn't wait at all. Plus, their customer service was great (the nicest mechanics ever seen!).

I truly recommend this place. This place saved our summer trip.
Again, choose this place for your car repair.

I also want to leave a thank-you note to the crew. Thank you for your amazing service!

resp.text: All in a day’s work, glad you’re happy with the results!

name: Tony Anthony
text: My name is Tony & I am the Service Manager at Colony One Auto Center in Stafford Tx. Our shop pride's itself in excellent customer service, after dealing with Harold Burns/ Chris over a potential catastrophe with one of our customers traveling through Mobile..........I can't be more grateful there are shops like this! These guy's were courteous, immediate and effective, its hard to get all those on the drop of a dime in an emergency situation. If anyone is travelling through Mobile (or near) or live in the area of, don't take my word for it, give these guy's a try! My thanks and gratitude for all you did Mr. Burns, Chris and the business as a whole!!!!!

text: Wow, just wow. These guys EARN 5 stars hands down. I have a 01 Rodeo which are known to be difficult to work on especially for alignments. These guys deserve your business. Very homely eager to help group of individuals. The alignment guy went above and beyond to hear what I had to say and at least help my situation even though he told me upfront it would be a difficult fix. Every person here, acted like they were there to help you and want your business to come back. From the first phone call, to the moment I left this shop was honest and fair. As a mechanic of 11 years, a shop like this is a needle in a hay stack. I will send everyone I know to this place. Seriously they were that good.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

text: I enjoyed my visit. Great service

resp.text: Joy, we are thrilled to hear that you are satisfied with your visit to JacMac Tire Company! Delivering the best tire and automotive service possible is always our goal.

name: Brooks B
text:
JacMac Tire and service was not busy today, which was good for me and for them. I usually get depressed when my car gets sick because RARELY do I walk away without spending a grand. But this visit was very pleasant. The customer service man asked me what was wrong with my vehicle, then asked me for the key. He went out and took my car for a test drive, then onto the rack. I waited in the lobby waiting area for a very brief time and then he came back. He told me I had a couple of options. Option one included replacing brake rotors and option two, pads only. I took the less expensive option two because money was tight. My total bill was HALF of what I assumed it would be. At JacMac, the difference is simple. They don't seem to want to drain your checking account like other places around Tuscaloosa who want to bill you no less than 1000 dollars every time you walk in the door. And I really like that he OFFERED me the different options. Most places dont do that. They make you ASK for less expensive options then say, welllllll, but, if you do that then this will happen, etc.
I think I just found "my mechanic."

resp.text: We're glad we were able to offer you the service you needed, Brooks! Let us know if there is anything else we can do for you, and we look forward to working with you again!

name: C.J. Sealy
text:
Quick service and reasonable prices for tire work.

However, this is what won my respect:
I came in to get my tire patched after running over a screw.  The mechanic patched my tire but accidentally stripped a lug nut when putting it back on. I noticed it once I got home and called the service desk.  They assured me I could come anytime over the next few days to fix the problem.  I showed up the next morning with a $5.18 lug nut from Nissan to replace the stripped one.  Not only did the mechanic fix it right away, the manager voluntarily reimbursed me without me bringing it up.

Mistakes happen...  It makes me happy to see a business doing the right thing. Especially without being prodded.

5 stars for this business!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review us! We are so happy to hear that you had a great experience at our location and hope to see you next time!

Most places won't do for a new customer what they did for me, and believe me when I say I appreciate it. I think the crew here's gonna see me again for my car maintenance. This is how you do business right - treat the customers with a little respect, help them out, and you'll have them for life. Thanks again JacMac, the car feels great. I'll be back again soon.

P.S. ask about the magnetic helmet in the office. Pretty crazy little thing. Two championships off but still fun.

name: LJ Pack
text: These people have communication issues. We went to make a deal on a used vehicle. We almost made the deal twice. After making our down payment and payment requirements very clear, the sales persons involved went to get approval. When they returned, the vehicle had been discounted, but they added a "fee." That's the only thing he would say, "a fee." They were trying to deliberately be vauge and, in our opinion, dishonest. After discussing their "fee," we never actually achieved full disclosure. We were told the vehicle was at a different dealership within our city and we could go there to finalize the deal. They said that they would call ahead and we should just go over there. Our credit had already been run multiple times, and we had received approval from the credit company. With this in mind, we went to the other dealership location. As we arrived at the other location, they hadn't been given all the details as we had been led to believe. So the process began again, running in circles of double talk and running our credit again... We left at closing time and expected a phone call the next day to complete the deal... That has yet to happen days later. I used to have great respect for Greenway Automotive. It appears that Greenway has only taken over these dealerships at face value, and the same crooks that were already in place are still running things just like they always have. Avoid Greenway Honda in Florence, AL, and Greenway Chevy in Muscle Shoals, AL, if you are planning to make a deal on a used car. They are not to be trusted unless you have the cash to pay up front or your own financing.

resp.text: LJ, we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience. This is not the level of customer service that we strive to provide at Greenway. We take customer satisfaction very seriously and we hope to have another opportunity to show you that. Should you wish to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to our General Manager, Jesse Gouvin, at jessegouvin@greenway.com. Thank you for your patience.

text: Message #2 Besides Michael Anders & Mr. Burnett & General mgr and others I also loved the service dept at Greenway Honda of Florence. The whole dealership receives 5 stars from me and I shopped around & they had the best price on my new truck.

text: RIVIERA TIRE gets 0 stars for their terrible service decisions but I was forced to give 1 star to post my comment.  I'm on the road again thanks to MAVIS TIRE!  I had a blowout  on a trailer tire and I HAD THE NEW TIRE .  I simply needed a tire mounted on the rim. They turned down my business because I didn't buy the tire from their shop. 1st time in my 42 years I have had that excuse told to me.  The truth is there wasn't enough profit to get someone out of their chairs to do their job.  So that's how you end up with  negative reviews.  Thank god for MAVIS TIRE!  !!!!!

resp.text: I am sorry that we were not able to meet your needs. I do not know if it was conveyed properly, but our GL insurance policy forbids us from mounting a tire from an unknown source (new or used) & has further stepped it up by not allowing us to sell used tires. We are aware of the situation & have been looking for other insurance carriers with competitive rates. I am glad that Mavis was able to help you & get you back on the road. It is hard for us to compete with a nationwide chain who has deeper pockets & more buying/saying power. Have a great day!

name: Jamie Rasinen
text:
PLEASE READ:
I brought my 2005 Nissan Frontier here to get a check engine light looked at and diagnosed. It was running fine, but I wanted to get it checked out before it could develop into something worse. It was throwing a catalytic converter code and the mechanics told me that they could get it fixed by replacing two engine valve cover gaskets. While they had it they also replaced two oxygen sensors and two spark plug coils. The grand total came out to $850 but I was satisfied to just get it fixed. The same day that I picked it up I was heading up to Auburn for a football game. I had been driving it for around 2 hours since I had given them my money when the engine made a loud pop, smoke poured out of the hood, and the truck shut off while I was driving down the interstate. I managed to pull off to the side of the road and come to a stop. After letting it cool for a while, I tried to restart the truck but it was completely shot. I always get my oil changed regularly, but I did check the dipstick and it had an appropriate amount of oil. I of course then called Riviera and explained what had happened, expecting them to arrange a  tow back to the shop since they had had it there less than 3 hours ago. Unfortunately, they told me that they could not possibly have done anything that would have caused that, and they would not cover the price of a tow or diagnosing of what had went wrong. This left me stranded on the interstate where I had to call and pay for a different towing company to give the truck a tow to a local mechanic as well as a rental car to get me to Auburn. The next day the mechanic gives me a call letting me know that the engine was completely shot and that the only options were to either scrap it or put a new used engine in for $3700. I called Riviera and told them the news and once again they told me that nothing they could have done would have caused that and that they could not help me. Since then, I have called trying to arrange a meeting with the owner/operator of Riviera to discuss what has happened and what our options will be moving forward. I have been told that I am unable to have a sit down meeting with him and whatever I need to say can be taken care of over the telephone. Basically, they have offered zero help or willingness to see what happened and if one of their guys caused it. I have gotten several second opinions from local mechanics as to what could have caused this and they have all said that it would be extremely rare for a 2005 engine to just blow up with absolutely no indication beforehand and with plenty of oil. They all also agreed that it would be the responsibility of Riviera to at least tow it back to the shop, pull out the engine, and determine what went wrong and if they had caused it. One told me about a similar situation that had happened at his shop, so he got it towed back, pulled out the engine, and found that one of his guys had dropped a wrench in the engine, causing the failure. So he took care of it and ordered a used engine for the customer and installed it at no charge since they had clearly made the mistake. I have had no other option, so I am currently in the process of taking the management at Riviera to court in hopes to get some compensation for the $850 service that I payed, the $3700 engine replacement, along with the rental car and towing charges that I have had to pay.

The bottom line is, pay the money to take your vehicle to a better quality mechanic shop that actually has a reputation they must live up to to avoid a situation like this!

resp.text: Hi Tom, thank you for your review. We replaced the valve cover gaskets because they were pouring oil onto your exhaust. We spoke with the repair facility where your vehicle was towed & they stated what we did hadn't nothing to do with your engine failure & that the valve covers were dry. They also informed us that there was a significant amount of sludge in your oil pan that happens over time, not immediately. We are sorry that this incident happened & it is very unfortunate, but the repair facility where your vehicle was towed advised us that it was a fluke & nothing we did caused the engine failure.

text: It has been about a month since I had my tire service done at Grady's. Excellent customer service and price. I waited in the lobby while they mounted and balanced my 4 new tires. The whole time the staff was super friendly and engaged with me in interesting conversation making me feel more welcomed. They told me I needed new brakes and a rear rotor (which I did, and already bought the parts on Amazon before going to Grady's) and I appreciate how they didn't try to pull any sneaky fees on me. My only complaint is that when I got my car home, I checked the pressure in all 4 tires and each were off. One tire had 65 pounds of pressure in it! The other 3 had around 20-25 pounds of pressure. My tires are supposed to hold 35 pounds of pressure, so needless to say I had to do some air pressure adjustments. Nonetheless, I have no hard feelings, and understand this was probably an overlooked mistake. I still recommend Grady's and will continue using them in the future (checking tire pressure before leaving the parking lot next time.)

The team put degreaser on the oil that had splashed onto the car and washed it down so they could get back on them road. text: Blew out a tire on my jeep wrangler while on a trip from Montgomery to Atlanta and then back to Florida. Tow truck towed me to Hester's. They called me the next morning and informed me that my Jeep was ready to go. They even came and picked me up at the hotel and brought me back to their shop. Once again, saving me from having to get a cab. They got me back on the road and I was able to complete my trip with no more problems. They were all extremely nice and very professional. Can't say enough good things about them. Thanks to all the staff that helped me out of a bad predicament. You guys rock!!!

name: JaQuana Smith
text: My prices seem to be higher than others that get the same thing done there. I was charged 90 for an oil change and it was just regular oil but the guy after me was only charged 54. Also a 10% fee was added for using my debt card but I had bought tires from there 2 days before and a lady checked me out and there was no 10% fee added on that receipt and I had used the same card. My advice is have them write the price down b4 they start because they will nickel and dime u to death.

resp.text: Jaquana I am sorry you feel this way, however there are a few reasons your oil change was more. 1) Your car required a synthetic oil change which was $47.95. 2) Your car required an air filter, we ask you if you wanted us to change it and gave you the price of the air filter which was $25.13, and you told us to go ahead and change it. 3) We topped off all of your fluids including antifreeze and windshield washer fluid. In regards to the 10% fee for using a debit card, that is just untrue. We have never charged anyone for using their card. I reviewed your ticket and I would be glad to discuss with you further please feel free to give me a call at 334-576-2248. Thank you.

name: Roy Hunt
text:
Everyone very hush hush, talking  why looking somewhere else, very pessimistic, Doomsday attitude. I know it's all to protect them from liability suits. What ever happened to trust, recommendations, honest opinions? Every answer to every question seemed will rehearsed. Two days later my alternator goes out! Maybe a coincidence, but it seems like everyone I put my trust in the professionals, things start going wrong with my car. Don't trust mechanics, lawyers, maintenance individuals, had one of them tell me, "if we fix it too well, we'll be out of a job, always have to leave something for another day." There's no real honest people in this area, not anymore. Bureaucrats have got their fingers into everything. Law suits are the "American Way!" So you can't really blame them to avoid taking responsibility for their actions. I know what my part costs, they were going to charge me nearly $500 in labor to loosen and tighten bout 6 bolts? A little extreme, they did an estimate but I never got to see it, I asked to see the defective part, but was given the excuse we would have to put it back on the lift. Since it wasn't on the lift, they had no plans to fix it!

Allen from Phenix Firestone called, his only concern was why I was so critical of him. I thought that was clear, but this was the second time I took this vehicle there for the same issue, the first time I was told nothing was wrong with it. In any case in order to resolve the problem Allen stated, "we're not working in your cars anymore!" I guess I hurt his feelings?

I used to love taking a vehicle to Phenix Firestone, always felt like they were looking out for me, always trusted them! Now I get the feeling I'm unimportant, it's really changed over the years!

Enough said hope you all have a great holiday I'll be home fixing my cars! LoL!

resp.text: Roy, thank you for taking the time to leave a thorough review! We welcome all feedback as hearing from our customers is the best way we can improve our business. We apologize for any inconvenience. Take care.

name: Keonte Gaddis
text: This is one of the most aggravating, frustrating experiences I’ve had in a longgg time! I took my car to Kia because my air wasn’t working they kept my car for a day and a half. I got my car back the air was working fine. I didn’t pay anything. About a week later I went back in for my follow up appointment because I was informed to bring the car back so they could check my Freon levels. I took the car back and the rep that car up to me informed me it would be 139.00 for a diagnostic reading. I got upset because if you charge to do a diagnostic reading why wasn’t that service performed the first time. I ended up getting a phone call back from a guy named Jaizon, that apologized about my previous encounter with the pricing and he informed me I wasn’t supposed to pay anything for the diagnostic fee.  I took my car back to the dealership and left it. A few hours later I get a phone call from a totally difference representative that tells me I’m going to have to pay 280 dollars for them to figure out what’s wrong with my car. I informed them to have my car ready for me to pick it up then five minutes later the same rep called me back and stated they would knock 100 dollars off of the 280 to make it 170 for the diagnostic fee. I’ve gotten literally four prices for simply finding out what’s wrong with my car. I’ve wasted my time, and gas by making trips up there that was a complete waste of time! I’ve gotten more lies and inaccuracy from this company than any other company in Huntsville thus far. And I’ve only been in Huntsville about 2 years. They will NEVER have to worry about me bringing my car there again. That’s for sure! Giving them one star is too much credit, I wish I could remove it too!!! If you thinking about going DONT DO IT!!!

name: Katrina Sharp

I have called numerous times trying to find out what is taking so long since my car is covered under the warranty that I purchased when I brought the car from Kia of Huntsville. Charlie Musick is the advisor and said he would return my call all 4 times but not once has he called to let me know the situation. I WILL NOT BUY ANOTHER CAR FROM HERE DUE TO THAT FACT IF SOMETHING TARES UP (EVEN AS SIMPLE AS THE SUN ROOF) IT TAKES OVER 3 WEEKS TO FIX IT!

name: Erin Marie
text: This is the place to go for all of your tire needs! If I could give them 10 stars I would. The location is extremely clean, the staff are excellent, & the customer service is phenomenal. Corey, the general manager, understood my needs & the urgency of it. He went above & beyond to help me get my wheel fixed as soon as possible!! Everybody is so friendly & Corey is FANTASTIC. He is so great about calling customers with updates, I never even had to call them to ask about updates. I recommend this location & I will continue to come to this location for all my car/tire needs! Thank you guys so much, especially Corey, y’all are the best!!!!

resp.text: Awesome! Glad we could get you safely on the road, Erin. We will see ya again when ya need us.

name: Jason Mishtawy
text: Very dishonest place! Claimed I only had 1-2 mm of brake pads left on my rear brakes and that my rotors were "cracked"... Pads actually had 50% life remaining and rotors were fine! Do not trust their assessments of anything without inspecting yourself or with a qualified mechanic.

resp.text: Honesty is one of our core values and we take all customers feedback to heart. Thank you for alerting us, Jason. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concern. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? We look forward to connecting.

text: Corey and the team did an excellent job replacing my car's tires with an alignment. The car now drives like a new one. I witnessed the team helping other customers in detail while I waited. Thanks!

resp.text: Aww, group hug. We love having you in the TD family, Chris. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

Sam brought out car back and was very polite and professional. A+

name: Shaun Bundy
text: I would give zero stars if could, because that's exactly how much service I received. Had a 2pm appointment for oil change, showed up at 1:45pm. He said they would get right on it. At 3:20pm, over 1.5 hours later, I hadn't heard a peep from anyone. I got up to check on it, on crutches BTW, and see my vehicle sitting in the parking lot. I thought it was complete, and asked why no one let me know. He informed me that they hadn't even touched it yet. I asked for my keys, and voiced my displeasure. He handed me my keys, and never once offered any kind  of apology . Why take appointments if you have no intention of honoring it?!

resp.text: Thank you for the alert, Shaun. We definitely respect your time & take your feedback seriously. We do get backed up from time to time, but the team should be providing updates throughout to let you know of any unexpected delays. That being said, we'd like to connect & learn more. If possible, please send your preferred method of contact to support@tirediscounters.com. Once received, a member of the team will reach out. We value your insight and hope to chat soon.

text: These guys are awesome! They have always treated us right. My wife works next door and they will bring the car to her and drop it off. resp.text: Aww, group hug! We love having you and your wife in the TD family, Phillip. You've got us for life!

name: Daniel Webster
text: I purchased almost 2 thousand dollars worth of tires from this location for a 2008 dodge dually in September 2020. On February 15th 2021 I took truck in for a rotation and brake inspection. They did the rotation wrong and put two tires that were worn way down and put on outer tears which started skinning them fast. Less than 200 miles down the road and the rear brake pads were metal on metal yet they supposedly just did a brake inspection. Today I took truck back so they could address the issues they cause and they wanted me to pay for their errors. I was fine with covering costs of brakes but the tires was their error. They did want to take care of me the customer. I picked my truck up and will leave this same review on every site I can find and contact an attorney Monday morning to address this matter.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, Daniel. We've got an open ticket for ya in our system and we'll be in touch to get to the bottom of this soon. Make sure to send us your contact info if you haven't already done so to support@tirediscounters.com. Talk soon.

resp.text: Woohoo! We love having you in the TD family, Jennifer. We will see ya again when ya need us.

resp.text: We rock so you can roll. Happy to have ya in the TD family, Pierre. You've got us for life.

name: Stephen Youngblood
text:
I made an 8 am appointment to get one tire changed. I learned don’t ever make an 8 am appointment. It’s 830 and my truck still hasn’t even been pulled in so now I have to scramble to reschedule meetings this morning. Use discount tire instead they keep their appointment times and don’t have people laying out tire displays instead of taking care of customers. Then when they get it in and go to put the new tire on the guy stands there for 5 minutes texting instead of installing my tire....over an hour and a half for one tire as the first appointment of the day and first one signed in.

DO NOT USE FIND SOMEWHERE BETTER

resp.text: Hi Stephen, we apologize that we did not meet your expectations. We take great pride in our craft and try to ensure that all of our services are completed to process and timely. We have pulled up your invoice and will be creating a customer escalation ticket to be reviewed by the Regional Manager who will be contacting you shortly. Thank you for being a valued Tire Discounters customer and we hope to see you again when you need us!

The service was top notch and they were very friendly and professional. The shop and waiting area was very clean.

text: I brought a tire in to have a leaky bead fixed, and was told they couldn't touch it because it was older than 2007, and it was against the law. Also, their oil changes are wayyyy to expensive.  You can go pretty much anywhere else and save some cash.

resp.text: We take the care of our customer's vehicles very seriously. Thank you for informing us, Stan. We want to dig in to learn more about your experience and work to improve going forward. If you could, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon!

name: Swainer (swainer)
text: These guys are incredible. ALL OF THEM! I have always gone to Discount Tires ...up until now.  I have never met a bunch of guys with better customer service than these guys. We had a situation where we were traveling in our BMW i3 and had a blow-out and nobody- not even the BMW dealership in Huntsville had the tire in stock that our car required. Each and every one of them genuinely cared about our situation and never stopped trying to help us figure it out and get us back on the road. These guys went out of there way and took care of us and got what we needed done.  If I even lived in a 50 mile radius of this store and these guys they would have my business all day long. I cant say enough about these guys... it makes me feel really good that there are still people like this on this planet.  Don't go anywhere else, I can promise you that theres nobody else going to take care of you better than they can.

resp.text: Yeahhhhhh buddy! Glad we were able to take care of ya, Mark. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us. We love having you in the TD family.

name: Steve Zanussi
text:
After noticing at a road stop that there was a bubble on the sidewall of my tire while on a long trip, I went to the closest Tire Discounters I could find.  There I was told that it would be at least three hours to change my tire.  They referred me to this location--8873 Highway 72, Huntsville--several miles away.

Upon entering I was greeted by the General Manager, Tyler Thurmond, who assessed the tire, and notified me that they did not have my tire in stock.  (They did have it in stock at the first place, but they had never checked.)  Tyler told me that it would take an hour and a half to get the tire there, but that once they had it, it could be put on very quickly.

Tyler had the delivery of the tire expedited for us, because we mentioned that we had to get up north by a set time.  The entire visit took about 45 minutes, including the delivery of the tire.

Thank you so much, Tyler Thurmond, for your exceptional customer service.  If I find myself needing a tire in Huntsville again, I know where I will go.

resp.text: Wowzeritos! Thanks for the review, Steve. We really appreciate the 5 stars and hope to see ya again for any of your tire or auto care needs! Take a look at our full services at https://tirediscounters.com/services

name: Andrew Smith
text: BUYER BEWARE!  I would recommend to do research on any pricing they give you.  Here is what happened.  Called got a verbal quote of $139-189 per axle for a brake job with rotor's turned which is fair they are just below the dealer which was $200 per axle.  Went the next day to have services done to my car.  Before they began work they inspected it and determine I needed pads all the way and rotor's on the rear and a brake fluid exchange.  Estimate price was over $700.  I declined the brake fluid exchange and they offered some "competitive" discounts brought my total down to about $580.  Still more than it should be.  Asked for a printed estimate when I saw the estimate I knew something was up.  They had part numbers and prices on the estimate.  Quick Google search confirmed the part numbers and prices from a local part supply store that they would be getting the parts from.  They are marking up parts pricing 100+%.  Industry standard is between 10-25%.  Then they told me that the estimate was nearly at cost and if he went any lower he would lose his job.  Nothing but scam and scare tactics were used with me and I didn't take the bait.  Tried to email the address on the general managers card it wouldn't ever go through.  Called the corporate office gave them the info and the pictures I have attached here and they said a regional manager would get back with me still have not heard from that person either.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE AND THE CHECK ANY PRICES THEY GIVE YOU!

resp.text: We take pride in our craft and place a great amount of emphasis on pricing ourselves competitively. We are continuously evaluating. We want to dig in to learn more. If you are willing, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon.

text: Excellent customer service ! I was out with my daughter, and the tire light came on pulled in to another facility they said it would be a couple of hours they were busy. I then drove to tire discounters and pulled in to see if I could get air in my tires. The service guy filled up my tires, but informed me I had a nail in one of my tires. Jody and Sarah got my car  straight in to the garage and my tire being fixed.  The customer service that the two of them and there staff showed today helped turn a bad day into a BLESSED DAY. My daughter and I sat for a little bit and before I knew it the tire was repaired. Thanks  guys for helping us out ! We will definitely come back to see you in the future !

text:
My daughters '05 CR-V had a possible battery-drain/Charging system issue. Battery was dead after the car was sitting for 5 days. She got a jump and headed to Advanced-Auto. They replaced the battery (it needed to be replaced anyway) and then they did a charging system check - inconclusive...it *may* be the alternator .

This is when we  found Whitt's  - they confirmed it was not the charging system but rather a parasitic load on the system,  a 0.6A draw killed her battery over 5 days.  Whitt's found the offending culprit and we were out the door for less than $60.   Very pleased with their service.

name: T. Ferguson DiazBrothersFan
text: I gave one star because the girl at front is very sweet and there was a helpful guy, but we left car on a Wednesday at 10am. I explained we really needed the car asap because I have cancer and lupus etc and will be hard for me to give people rides to work etc at 5am! They explain there was cars in front of mine (6) Thursday it was to be done...nope! Friday the were sure by then...NO, the mechanic that looked at it had left for the day and weekend. The other mechanics had jobs and they couldn't get to mine...nothing! They need a mechanic for minor jobs like mine (bearings to be replaced) and other mechanics for the bigger jobs...if you got one car and need it done same or next day or actually in three ...don't go here! I feel the mechanic that looked at the car should have just fixed it. Oh they were supposed to have called as well..no such thing happened, the mechanic just didn't want to do the job! I have never taken a car somewhere where they did not have their stuff together like this place! Never even called for a status update or to tell us anything about the car! Taking car to another place who can have work done in one hour!!! The car set there for 3 days!!!!!

name: Carole Juarez
text: Amazing company!!!  We were referred by discount tire. Polite hard-working people. Thank you for putting us back on the road so quickly. Feeling safe Carole

name: Joe Shultz
text:
I went there for a new water pump for a Chevy SUV. A new water pump was installed, but didn't last 100 miles. I returned the vehicle only to have the auto shop refuse to replace the water pump free of charge. I removed the water pump that weekend to find they cross threaded the new water pump and warped the unit. No wonder it did not function properly. After re-tapping a couple of screws and several hours out of my Saturday I replaced the new pump myself. Now I am out the price of another water pump, thanks a lot.

Many people do not know this, but each repair job has an attached amount of time associated with it. So, if an auto center changes your brakes in 30 min but the book says it takes 1.5 hours, then the shop charges you for the extra hour as an extra rake. Now, I do not mind paying the extra as long as the quality matches. This shop may do quick work, but it is not at the quality I am paying for. Poor value given, and they would not make it right either. Basically the repair guy did not remove all the necessary components (like a radiator) to save some time and shoved the water pump in at an angle.

I will never use them again.

name: Heather M
text: Griffin is a lifesaver! My truck blew a spark plug and I had two kids with me along with my husband. We were about 300 miles from home! I thought we were stranded and repair was going to cost a fortune. Griffin used his OWN vehicle to drive 3 exits up to assist us. He was able to get the undamaged spark plug back in and also brought us a brand new coil pack and put it in. He did this repair out of the kindness of his heart and we cannot thank him enough! He was honest from the get go. He could have told us the truck needed a new head or worse and made a ton of money, but he fixed the problem quickly and didn't charge us a fractuon of what he could have! Thank you Griffin, you were our Angel! His shop may be behind sometimes, but he is worth the wait if you want an honest mechanic!

name: Sheree Lewis
text: New owner, great guy great work! I recommend this place for all your auto work .

name: Travis Gibbs
text:
I brought my car and truck to them when they first opened. They fixed both and stuck to fair estimate.

I wouldn't do business with them now after my last experience.

Month 1 & 2
Our car needed a new engine. The shop owner wanted to get an engine from his supplying junkyard. He missed one that became available. This process took about 2 weeks before we decided to find an engine ourselves which he was not happy with but agreed to. He said they could have it put in within a 3 day period. The engine company we bought from needed it done in 10 days for warranty purposes. Griffith used all of the 10 days to because other cars came in front of me while we had to wait on engine. They finally got it in and started but had to send to dealership because the car went into anti-theft mode and wouldn't start. We had to actually arrange the drop off to the dealership ourselves. I feel like we were running his business for him because he was almost never there. The employees even mentioned that problem in passing.

Month 3
We become worried after not hearing anything from dealership or Griffin for about 2.5ish weeks. I had to contact dealership for them to tell me that they told Griffin that the car needed a major fuse panel that could be $1200+. I called Griffin to tell him I approved the install because we really needed the car. It's month 3 folks!

Is it Month 4? Getting close anyway.
We had to go ourselves to the dealership to confront them about not getting to our car. This should be Griffin's job. The dealership says that the part didn't fix the problem. Car still doesn't work. We decide to give up because the car needed another part for $2400 to "maybe" fix. We decide to just give up. Dealership is trying to get more money from us even though they didn't fix the problem. Griffin is trying to put that on us. We said we would pay for his time, but does this seem fair? Griffin himself might be a knowledgable mechanic, but he is a rookie business owner with no organization or management skills of his people.  He wasted a huge amount of our time (3+months), money ($6000+) and stressed my wife and I to no end. We are going to have to scrap our car with a new engine that doesn't run.

They do good oil changes and put a muffler on another car we brought, but he also made me pay for the part up front which shows bad business to me as well.

* FINAL RESULT
paid griffin $1400 because the car ended up not working out. He said he made no money and it would have been $2000 if it had worked + whatever it would be to charge AC. When we walked in to pay he didn't even recognize us. My wife and I talked to this guy several times in person and on phone. The waiting area had mice running around too FYI if you are scared of them. After that we went to the dealer shop that had our car and basically gave it to the tech working on it. he paid for the dealer work and gave us a little cash. When we went to clean the car out I noticed that the driver seat leather looked very dirty and worn. Griffin said he was sorry.

name: Kristina Garrison
text: I am honestly disappointed, this shop has Amazing POTENTIAL. However, I don't feel it is being ran efficiently. I have called with no answer, mupltiple occasions. I also have the concern of the child/childern that are running through shop all day, most days. I have also had to keep from hitting many toys, many times. I believe the shop is in an amazing location, and again has all potential in the wprld. Unfourtnally, right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

name: Chris Ruffin
text:
I moved to McCalla in March of 2015. I was looking for a dependable repair shop that did quality work and that I could become a repeat customer with. I chose Griffin Automotive because they are ASE certified and after using them with 3 vehicles (06 Nissan Altima, 05 Chevy Silverado, & 2015 Nissan Altima) I have had no complaints with them.

They do great work, and are realistic with their estimates. If you are looking for a repair shop with a quick turnaround (meaning hours instead of days) then this may not be the shop for you, but I have a spare vehicle and can leave the vehicle for repairs.  They typically tell me that they have other vehicles in front of mine, but will look at it as soon as they get a free moment. I have sent my cars or truck to them at least 9 times (using both the overnight drop box and just bringing it in) and have only waited longer than a day once (and that was because the part got their late in the evening and I picked it up after work the next day)

I have had multiple types of jobs: brakes pads for Altima and Silverado, rotors for Altima and Silverado,, brake drums for Silverado, oil change for Altima and Silverado, window regulator replacement on Silverado, oil leak repair on Altima, engine mounts on Altima, transfer case replacement Silverado 4x4, along with other normal maintenance type items

The managers, Tim specifically, are also patient, and helpful both on the phone and in store and truly take time out of their day to talk to you about servicing, previous records, dates of service, and HONEST recommendations. You will NOT wait in line here like you will at the dealership, the longest time I've waited for the entire oil change to be done is 15 minutes here, and that included the "wait" to begin. Everyone here has a great attitude and a willingness to help! name: Holly Carr
text: Went to this location for an oil change, but my tire pressure light was on so I got them to check on this too.  One of my tires was entirely too low (pressure at 15 when should be at 35, all other tires were only at 30).  Any knowledgeable technician would have removed my tire to check for a leak, but he insisted the tire was fine.  After filling the tires & resetting, the tire pressure light was still on.  He told me not to worry and to "be careful" with that tire--incredibly vague.  Turns out there was a leak, which left me with a flat tire & stranded in Atlanta the next day.  It's clear that the technicians I dealt with had a blatant disregard for my safety and the safety of my vehicle.  I will never return to another Express Oil Change, nor recommend this location to anyone I know.

text: Quick service, friendly technicians, easy to understand options! Adam was very helpful with understanding what we needed and how long it would take/how much it would cost! I will be returning!

name: Matthew Tucker
text:
I noticed gas dripping near my fuel filter.  I didn't know for sure exactly where or what was causing it, didn't want to spend my only free evening of the week with my wife and kid trying to figure it out, but also didn't want to leave a leak overnight so I took off work early to go get it fixed.  My vehicle needed an oil change as well anyway so I took it in and explained it was likely the filter or one of the lines that needed replaced.

Sure they changed my oil no problem, but the guy came around and said he wouldn't fix the leak, that it was a "missing o-ring that they didn't carry in stock" and I'd need to take it back to whoever put the existing filter on and have them do the repair.  Now, I replace my filters every 40,000 miles or so and I've moved a couple of times since then.  I have no idea where I was exactly when I replaced my filter last, because it's a small fix.  I got there at 4:30 pm, close of business at 6, so it wasn't like I pulled up at quitting time.  I had to take more time off work the next morning to disconnect everything myself and find it was simply a hairline crack in the filter.  The mechanic that I talked to didn't even verify anything, except what I already knew that yep there's a fuel leak there.  He just spewed some bs that he thought sounded good because he didn't feel like doing his job... REPLACING A DAMAGED FUEL FILTER SO I'M NOT DRIPPING GASOLINE EVERYWHERE I GO.

I'll find somewhere else for auto service, and I'd recommend you do the same if it's anything other than an oil change.

resp.text: Hi Matthew. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

text: Its amazing how God leads you in the right direction! My wife and I were 450 miles away from home and was having tire problems. The staff was amazing and a great group of people! The met me in the parking lot, got me in and pretty much just took over. Such a relief to find a place like this that knew what they were doing and to be treated the way we were! I will find out what the gentleman's name was and post it again, just because he was that kind of man! After all that! They would not let me pay them! And I tried! My wife was in tears (of relief and joy) because of him! I rated them 5 stars only because there isn't a sixth! That you guys and God bless them! We're finally home safe in NC only because of them! text: Had oil changed by Express and afterafter I noticed my car leaking oil. I took it back to Express and the guy said it was leaking from the drain plug and for me to go purchase one and bring it back and he would replace it. I take it back the next day and still leaking after replacing it and so the guy proceeds to say I need a new oil pan and they would email me the price for oil pan and installation. A week went by and I never received the email nor a phone call. I took my car to the dealer and and they replaced my oil pan. They said it was stripped and they (Express) had try to repair it with a repair kit but obviously didn't work. My car was not leaking oil before I took it to Express but was after they changed my oil and so they costed me $560+. I will not be going back to Express for anything.

name: phil lindley
text: I used to only drive big name brand tires$$$, which were usually put on at Sam's or Costo. After an issue with one of the $$$ tires purchased, I found out they are not a typical stock item and I'd have to wait for several days. Since I needed it repaired immediately, I drove directly to Pete Shirley and told them to get close on the orginal tires ratings (speed/trac/hardness) with something they normally stock and replace all 4. Not only did they drive the same,  they were significantly cheaper than the big name brands. The biggest plus, I was back on the road in about an hour. I've waited over 4hours at some places in the past. Since, I've replaced tires on my other 4 vehicles using Pete Shirley. Asked them to put on something they normally stocked on these 4 vehicles, and all road out great, and in and out of the store in a timely manner. They also don't sell the gimmicky road side warranty. But I'd bet they'd do all they could to help you out if something happens outside of the tires warranty.

text: The guys over at Express Oil in Muscle Shoals are unbelievable. Not these guys, they are in a league by themselves. They do great work, they are knowledgeable,  friendly, reliable and most important, Honest! Best of all they have another shop on site with techs that can do a wide range of repairs and diagnostics. Plainly put, you can rest assured that you, your wife, your teenager, etc will drive off with a well-serviced vehicle, Every Time!!

Please visit us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and leave your contact information, as well as the details of your experience, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

name: Mary Hall
text: I usually use a different service, but they were very backed up so I drove down the road just to have my tires checked because my TP light came on. The gentleman looked at my low tire for about 30 seconds and told me there was a nail and because of where it was on the tire they wouldn’t be able to patch it and I needed a whole new tire. Also that the tread on all my tires was getting low so I needed a whole new set. The set he tried to sell me was almost $1,000. Luckily I had my dog in the back seat, so I had a good excuse to get out of there and tell them I’d come back later. I don’t know a whole lot about cars, but I know when my tire tread looks low and I’ve got at least until the end of this year or the beginning of next before I’ll need new tires. And as for the one with the nail, my cousin patched it and I’ve driven to Birmingham and back on it with no problem at all. Seems like to me they saw a single woman and assumed I wouldn’t have any sort of knowledge and tried to take advantage.

resp.text: Hi Mary. We value your business and would like to address your concerns as quickly as possible. Please contact us at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ and include your contact information and the store you visited, so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you.

Coffee, a notebook and some small car part (not even sure what it was) were left in my car, none of which were mine, all of which I threw away. name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Jason Hughes
text:
Jaye at the front desk was very professional and courteous and the service was awsome so far, however I was charged 4 hours labor and it only took 2.. At over 100$ an hour labor, I had over 200 dollars stolen from me where service's were not performed... I have dealt with the public for a lot of years and in no way would my conscience allow me to do this to  my customers and then
try to  justify it by saying my computer says I have to.... This was my first and last time visiting Meineke...

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Jason. Our car care professionals are all about building trust and confidence. text: The service and this branch location was impeccable. Hunter the manager & my tech specialist Isaac were professional courteous and really went the extra mile to ensure that I was satisfied. They have definitely gained my business and I would personally recommend this location!

resp.text: Thank you for your wonderful review, Javan! Exceptional work and exceptional service are what it's all about. Thanks for shouting out Hunter, Isaac, and the team. You can count on our crew to go the extra mile. Happy to hear about the great work on your vehicle!

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

Definitely recommend going to Meineke Car Care Center on south parkway to see Andrew Boutwell.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Amber. Thanks for shouting out Andrew and his team. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

name: Alex Sims
text: Brought my car that was occasionally stalling out to get diagnosed and fixed up. They found the issue and fixed it. After a few hours, the work was done and they said they test drove my car to make sure it was working properly. I picked my car up right before they closed tonight and went on my way. Within 2 minutes, my car died in the middle of the street. The bumping and RPM fluctuations progressively got worse, and by the time i was able to get off the road, the car would only coast in drive. If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

resp.text: We understand your concerns, Alex. We want to make sure we are doing car care right. We are escalating your concerns internally and would like to connect with you directly. text: My radiator was leaking and I was having a hard time finding a place to fix it. They diagnosed it quickly and got a new radiator in the next morning (I first arrived 2 hours before close) and my car was fixed up before lunch the next day. They also did an oil change, replaced a filter, and looked at my tires. They had a shuttle also. Overall I was impressed.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Kathleen! We're glad to hear you had an easy and seamless experience. We're here to take all the stress out of auto services.

name: Robert Terry
text:
Absolutely stay away from this location. Do not trust them to perform a simple oil change. When you are charged for an oil filter that is not installed, it is called fraud. When you refuse to stand behind your work, You are not reputable. If you expect them to return your calls, you will be waiting till the cows come home.

Update-  Local store representative indicated "Corporate" would reimburse me for damage to oil cap housing.  "Corporate" called indicating any damages are the responsibility of the "Franchisee".  Once again, each is passing the buck but the customer gets hosed.  If the Franchisee is using the name "Meineke",  Corporate should be taking  more responsive action.  If you proclaim that you are customer oriented and responsive, just do the right thing and pay for the parts charged but not installed and the damage you caused.

resp.text: Meineke is all about trust, professionalism, and expertise. We're disappointed to hear you did not feel we lived up to this standard, Robert. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

resp.text: Earning the trust of our customers is paramount to our team, Richard, which is why it's so disappointing to learn you feel this way. text: I was there for an interview. Some people were a little " dry " and seemed too busy to bother with me. I felt out of place so I didn't even do the interview. Maybe if I was a customer I'd have been less of a problem for the desk guy  walking through the door. I saw a lot of people just relaxing on the phone up front so it seemed the ones in the back and outside were actually working. So see for yourself how you like it this is just my 1st and more than likely last experience at this place.

name: David Wydner
text: The guys did a great job getting my Tacoma in and out. Barely had time to get comfortable in the waiting area.

text: Real great service department

name: austin grace
text: Just bought a Tacoma With Zak Stidham, it was an awesome experience!

name: Alycia E
text: Don't waste your time like I did. Instead just make the trip over to Honda in Columbus. The service will be top-notch. I travel constantly and have owned Honda's for 25 years. I have been to dealerships everywhere. I had a minor issue that could have been fixed quickly. Upon arriving at the run down shop the workers did everything they could to avoid acknowledging me. Wish I could have got his name specifically in the parts dept. He literally jumped on his cell phone when he saw me walk up. He didn't have a name tag on. Then I went into the service dept door and the man behind the counter has the audacity to tell me we MIGHT get you some time this afternoon. Mind you I'm traveling through which I mentioned, and I'm a single female. The issue literally just required a look at and some advice. Being in the medical field I understand being busy better then anyone. BUT there is never an excuse for being rude, and dismissive in business. I literally drive 45 mins to another dealership because you guys were so rude!

name: Jackenstein
text:
If you’re not sure, DO NOT come here!
Last week I stopped in the service department to ask if they would be able to fix my car’s broken sunroof seal. It is torn, off of its track, dry-rotted and very obviously needs replacing. The man at the front desk walks out with me to my car to see the problem and sees it as clearly as I could. We went back into the shop to set up an appointment that ended up being for a whole week later which was excessively long for the possibility of my car getting flooded if it rained. Today after the week had gone by, I took my car in told them my name and that I had an appointment, which they seemed not to even have on their books of me scheduling, asked for my address, phone number, and for the keys. Nearly 2 hours later I finally get a call back from them saying they didn’t have the part in stock, that they hadn’t done any kind of research on what my options were before my appointment (which we agreed they would do), told me they couldn’t get the seal as an individual part but would have to replace the whole sunroof instead, and that if I wanted that done it would be over $700 for it or if not that they would only charge $110 for running their “diagnostics”. A fee for “Diagnostics” to look at my car for no more than a minute to tell my seal had dry-rotted and needed replacing, really? It ended up being $117.70 after an additional charge of “supplies and/or hazardous waste removal” for a single floor mat, some identifying tags for my car and keys and some receipts. Not to mention there wasn’t a seat cover used despite their own disclosure sign saying they would be using them to slow the spread of coronavirus. I do not feel as though this charge was necessary and very much should have been avoided if they would done the work that was expected of them ahead of time. They will not be receiving any more of my business nor should they receive yours if your issue isn’t urgent or too difficult to do yourself.

name: Jennifer Keller
text:
I took my car to be serviced for three warning lights that repeatedly came on intermittently  (VSA, Power Steering and Emission). They stated it would cost $120 to diagnose the problem. Four hours later they called to tell me they found two pistons misfiring but it would cost another $120 to go any further to determine what was causing it.

I would give a negative number if possible. This service department is BY FAR the most dishonest service department with whom I have ever dealt in the past 34 years that I have been driving. I wouldn’t take my bicycle to them for repairs!!

name: Kati's World
text:
Back in February I brought my car in for just an oil change, but it ended up costing me over 400 dollars. However, I was willing to pay for it since I live over an hour and a half away, and it is a big deal for my car to be safe. Immediately after I left I noticed that wind was whistling through one of my doors and my brakes were squeaking. Then my radio completely stops working, and I decided to give this place another chance. We then brought my car in to get diagnosed, and were not made aware that they did not have a shuttle or anyway for us to leave the property besides uber.  After the diagnoses we got told by the service lady, to bring our car back in two days on Wednesday and that our rental would be free for two days, and that warranty would be covering the costs. Later that day we get a call from this same lady and in this call she tells us that my car would cost us at least 1800 dollars to get fixed, and that we had to pay for the rental car that we were driving. They also said that the pipe that needed to be fixed was bent in on purpose, and that we had done it (keep in mind that the only people who drive this car are two females who know nothing about cars). We were livid. They put the car back together and we got a second opinion, and turns out what they stated is wrong isn't.

The sales lady also reprimended a child for something she knew nothing about. I would give this place zero stars if I had the option. Overall, this is the worst experience I have ever had with a car place!

name: Joy Johnson
text: Feel like I got a good deal. Photo is of a different lot. But King got my business on this same model. Saved $875 off LaGrange Honda.

name: Justin Smith
text: Thank you Rodney for making the buying experience smooth and simple! I had a professional, businesslike experience and made a deal for my new Honda. The model I wanted wasn't available on the lot, so they picked it up and drove it in from Huntsville, keeping me informed every step of the way. Call Rodney at King Honda when you are in the market for your next vehicle.

text: Nice people, but it kinda feels like a used car dealership externally. It’s any to miss on the road. Just not as nice as the local Nissan or Toyota dealership

text: Worst experience I have ever had with an auto service dealership. This makes Honda look really bad.  Dropped my daughters car off via AAA tow on Monday and nothing has happened. Communication has been lacking when they said they would call me back they never would and has happened every day since then. Experience has made me feel like they’re trying to screw me over and rip me off

text: Poor service sales man was awful

text: Amazing customer service — thanks Ricky! Had a great experience when I brought my car in very last minute. They were able to figure out what was wrong and fix it pretty quickly. Overall a great place.

text: Jay Manning made the process very smooth from the beginning. Very professional, polite and was able to help me find my perfect car within minutes. I will be recommending King Honda to my family and friends.

name: evelyn hodges
text: Really appreciate Stacey W for getting my part secured in a hurry on a saturday! Very dependable!

name: Maggie McCoy
text: I've been going here for a number of years for service on my Honda. I don't have anything but good things to say about them! I've always had a great experience and they really value loyal customers. They've kept my car running in perfect condition and never made me feel like they were upselling anything or treating me like a woman who doesn't know anything (a rare quality in my experience with car service shops!). They always take time to explain to me what was done and why they did it. They clearly indicate the wear on each of the car components so that I have a record and can anticipate service that I might need in the future. I went to another Honda location once and they said I needed new brakes. They didn't give me any other reason than the service guy's opinion. I took my car to King Honda and told them that the other place had said I needed new brakes at my next visit. King Honda measured the wear and said it wasn't necessary based on the wear. I was very impressed by the fact that they went by the numbers rather than taking the chance to sell me some brakes that I didn't really need quite yet. Even after I moved away from Auburn, I still come back to get my car serviced here. Thanks to everyone there for keeping me a happy customer!

text: Horrible service.

text: Great service on my car and friendly employee s
